*Thomas Randall Davidson (1747–1827), Church of Scotland minister

In 1794 William Davidson died and left the house and estate to his nephew Rev Thomas Randall of St Giles Cathedral, on condition that he assumed the name of Thomas Randall Davidson (which he did). His son William Davidson (1783-1865) inherited the house in 1827 when his father died.Fasti Ecclesiastae Scoticana by Hew Scott
* Elizabeth Cockburn (Cockpen, Midlothian, 5 November 1770 - 1850) second wife of Thomas Randall Davidson, grandmother of Randall DavidsonFasti Ecclesiastae Scoticana by Hew Scott

He was ordained as minister of the Scots Church at London Wall in 1832. In 1836 he was translated to Aberdeen South Parish and in March 1842 to the Tolbooth Church on the Royal Mile in Edinburgh in place of Rev Thomas Randall Davidson, but as first minister of the recently completed masterpiece by James Gillespie Graham and Pugin. He left the established church in the Disruption of 1843 and was thereafter a minister of the Free Church of Scotland.Ewing, William Annals of the Free Church
* 8 - Rev Thomas Randall Davidson, minister of Tolbooth parish in St Giles Cathedral

In May 1783 he was ordained as minister of Kippen. After two decades there, in October 1805 he was chosen as minister of Tolbooth parish, one of the four parishes contained within the subdivided St Giles Cathedral as second charge under Rev Thomas Randall Davidson. In 1806 he was chosen as Secretary of the Society for Propagating Christian Knowledge and in 1807 was awarded an honorary Doctor of Divinity by Edinburgh University. He is listed as living at Society Hall on the Netherbow.Fasti Ecclesiastae Scoticana by Hew Scott

He was ordained as minister of Auchterarder in September 1781. In September 1802 he was presented to the congregation of Ratho in West Lothian by his colleague Rev Dr Thomas Randall Davidson of Muirhouse and in March 1803 he translated to this new ministry.Fasti Ecclesiastae Scoticana by Hew Scott
